original_title: Sri Lanka ACU debt to Reserve Bank India converted to US$2.2bn swap
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s arrears to the Reserve Bank of India under the Asian Clearing Union and penalty interest have been converted into a 2.2 billion US dollar swap, an International Monetary Fund report said.
The ACU arrears has been combined with another 400 million US dollar swap given by the RBI under a South Asian Association for Regional Cooperation (SAARC).
The 2.6 billion dollar liability will be settled in the period 2023-2026.
A ceiling on Treasury guarantees set as an indicative target (IT) in the IMF program has been revised upwards to account for a Treasury guarantee issued to cover the swap.
Borrowings through central bank swaps allows a central bank to continue to suppress rates and avoid corrections to interest rates.
There has been no restraints placed on striking swaps in the new central bank law. (Colombo/Dec13/2023)
